alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 4:13PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...GUSTY OUTFLOW WINDS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL SANDOVAL AND BERNALILLO COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 412 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty outflow winds about 10 miles southwest of Paradise Hills, or 11 miles west of Albuquerque, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albuquerque, southwestern Rio Rancho and South Valley. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 140 and 154. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area
